name: thirdparty-component-dropbear-ssh-server
description: The Dropbear SSH server version 2012.55 contains multiple high-risk common vulnerabilities (CVE-2016-7406, CVE-2016-7407, etc.). Version evidence comes from the strings 'SSH-2.0-dropbear_2012.55' and 'Dropbear sshd v%s' in the .rodata section. It is recommended to upgrade to the latest version to fix potential vulnerabilities.

name: thirdparty-component-vsftpd
description: vsftpd version 2.3.2, no known CVEs specific to this version have been identified. Version evidence comes from the string 'vsftpd: version 2.3.2' within the binary file. It is recommended to check for more general vsftpd vulnerabilities and review the release notes for this version.
notes:
Suggestions:
1. Check the release notes and changelog of vsftpd 2.3.2
2. Expand the CVE search scope to all vsftpd versions
3. Verify whether this version includes patches for known vulnerabilities

name: thirdparty-component-wpa_supplicant

wpa_supplicant v0.5.9
Copyright (c) 2003-2007, Jouni Malinen <j@w1.fi> and contributors

name: thirdparty-component-BusyBox
description: BusyBox version 1.19.2, identified by the version string 'BusyBox v1.19.2 (2015-07-03 11:30:00 HKT)' found in the bin/busybox file using the strings command. While no direct CVEs were found specifically for version 1.19.2, multiple high-risk vulnerabilities (CVE-2019-5138, CVE-2016-2148, CVE-2021-42377) may affect this version.
notes: It is recommended to upgrade to the latest version (1.35 or higher) to fix potential vulnerabilities.

name: system-component-busybox-links
description: The system includes multiple symbolic links pointing to busybox, such as ash->busybox, cat->busybox, chmod->busybox, etc.
notes: Standard BusyBox configuration, but with increased attack surface
